intro: Tabernaemontana elegans, commonly known as the elegant star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many toxic and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and are highly fragrant. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy texture, while its stems are woody and branching. Tabernaemontana elegans is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant due to its striking blooms and relatively low maintenance requirements.
